discussion.content: I read Clientless remote network access and knew it was E due to SSH
A,C and D are eliminated right off the jump, seeing as the need speed of excess 150mbps. leaving you with B and E. Clientless- REMOTE net access. is a dead give away for a VPN sooo there you have it.

comments.content: A is slower than the requested speed.
Key phrase "clientless remote network access". SSL-VPN can be done through a browser whereas VPN with IPSEC requires a VPN client to be installed on the computer

questions.question_text:
An engineer is reviewing the implementation requirements for an upcoming project. The basic requirements identified by the customer include the following:
✑ WLAN architecture supporting speeds in excess of 150 Mbps
✑ Clientless remote network access
✑ Port-based network access control
Which of the following solution sets properly addresses all of the identified requirements?
A technician needs a way to allow clients to access a new application server on the network. Which of the following should the technician set up to achieve this objective? (Choose two.)

discussion.content: Js, I definitely relate to your point-of-view as that was my first answer. Logically, a network would definitely need to have a DHCP and DNS services in place, but in typical CompTia fashion, important information about the environment is left out. After re-reading, I interpreted it as that a functioning network already exists and is asking what is needed specifically for the server itself to come online and be accessible. While I would personally give a server a static IP, a reservation can be equally appropriate. Where the question is focusing on what the server needs, I feel the given answer is correct.
My point of view answers should be A and B.
MAC address is the data link layer

questions.question_text: Which of the following OSI layers is represented by a physical address that is assigned by the manufacturer?

discussion.content: Because a generator maintains, it doesn't protect. A UPS will trigger immediately when utility power goes out and will temporarily provide power (protect from data loss) while the generator starting process is initiated.

questions.question_text: Which of the following is used to protect the servers when a datacenter fails over from a primary power source to a secondary power source?

Company A has leased a second office located two floors below its main office. Company B is located on the floor in between Company A's office and is performing research on electromagnetic fields. The core switch at the MDF is connected to the switch at the IDF with a 131ft (40m) Cat 6 UTP cable. Both gigabit switches support Cat 7a and have SFP ports available. Company A's second office has reported intermittent issues with slow and sometimes dropped connections to the main office network. Which of the following steps will MOST likely resolve the connectivity issues? (Choose two.)

choices.D: Connect the switches with a Cat 7a UTP cable.
choices.E: Connect the switches using a plenum-rated Cat 7a UTP cable.
choices.F: Connect the switches using a gigabit powerline adapter.
choices.C: Connect the switches with a Cat 6 STP cable.
choices.B: Connect the switches with a fiber cable via SFP.
choices.A: Connect the switches using an 802.11ac bridge.

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: BC
With EMI you sort of want Fiber or STP cables to counteract the interference of possible EMI distruption. So my best guess is B and C.
